body_html: @karmel Yes, the values in the unit tests were probably calculated with wrong formulas. In the faulty unit test, an RNN is built and then gradients are calculated. I'm not sure how the RNN are implemented precisely so I cannot manage to get the right number of flops. If anyone would like to contribute by calculating the right number of flops...
